img.alt: Reports of Child Abuse Are Down No Cause to Celebrate

a.title: Reports of Child Abuse Are Down No Cause to Celebrate

div.a: Reports of Child Abuse Are Down No Cause to Celebrate
div.div: As Child Prevention Awareness month comes to a close and school will no longer be open, mental health professionals express concern that reports of abuse will be reduced. But that reduction doesn't mean abuse isn't happening.
div.a: Read More About Reports of Child Abuse Are Down No Cause to Celebrate

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Meals, Instruction and Mental Health - WCS Priorities

a.title: Meals, Instruction and Mental Health - WCS Priorities

div.a: Meals, Instruction and Mental Health - WCS Priorities
div.div: The mental health and well-being of students has been a priority since schools closed in March. Choosing to focus on learning engagement rather than formal instruction is one means by which the school system helped to reduce stress in an already stressful time.
div.a: Read More About Meals, Instruction and Mental Health - WCS Priorities

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Mental Health Resources in the Weakley County Area

a.title: Mental Health Resources in the Weakley County Area

div.a: Mental Health Resources in the Weakley County Area
div.div: Students and their families have several resources available to them. Websites and phone numbers listed here offer awareness and/or a direct connection to trained professionals.
div.a: Read More About Mental Health Resources in the Weakley County Area

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Therapists Offer Suggestions for Talking with Children

a.title: Therapists Offer Suggestions for Talking with Children

div.a: Therapists Offer Suggestions for Talking with Children
div.div: The COVID-19 crisis can produce fear and anxiety in children. Area therapists and national experts offer tips and suggestions on how to address concerns and focus on well-being.
div.a: Read More About Therapists Offer Suggestions for Talking with Children

a.title: Schools Closed -- All scheduled activities suspended

div.div:
Schools Closed -- All scheduled activities suspended
c

a.title: CANCELLED -- Westview Jazz Band and Chorus Concert

div.div:
CANCELLED -- Westview Jazz Band and Chorus Concert
c

div.p: Weakley County Schools is home to 10 schools in Northwest Tennessee. Over 300 innovative educators in the towns of Dresden, Gleason, Greenfield, Martin and Sharon serve over 3,900 students inlocal community public schools. Our faculty to student ratio is 1:13.(For school list and more information, click here.)

p.span: Weakley County Schools will not discriminate on the basis of race, creed, color, handicap, national origin, gender, age, political affiliation or beliefs (Board Policy #6.304). Complaint procedures related to harassment/discrimination for employees and students are listed under Board Policies 5.500, 5.501, 6.304, 6.305 and may be made available in other languages as necessary.

div.div:
8319 Highway 22, Suite A, Dresden, TN 38225
Phone 731.364.2247 | Fax 731.364.2662
